abstract: Federal Election Commission releases data showing fines for campaign finances violations have dropped to record lows, despite fact that political spending has greatly increased; Democrats on commission view statistics as indication of lax enforcement while Republicans say drop reflects better training and compliance programs.
lead_paragraph: Democrats on the evenly divided Federal Election Commission, including the chairwoman, see evidence of lax enforcement. Republicans credit greater compliance.

headline.main: F.E.C. Data Shows Campaign Fines Hit Record Low in 2014
headline.print_headline: Election Commission’s Fines Down by Half in 2014 to $597,429, a New Low

snippet: Democrats on the evenly divided Federal Election Commission, including the chairwoman, see evidence of lax enforcement. Republicans credit greater compliance.
